title: Lagrange Basis Polynomial
content: l_k(x) = ∏_{j≠k} (x - xⱼ)/(x_k - xⱼ) satisfies l_k(xⱼ) = δ_{kj}. These form a basis for polynomial interpolation of degree ≤ n-1.

title: Lebesgue Function
content: Λ(x) = Σ_k |l_k(x)| measures how much interpolation amplifies pointwise errors. The Lebesgue constant is max_x Λ(x).

title: The Υ Functional
content: Υ = min_{0≤i≤n} max_{x∈[xᵢ,xᵢ₊₁]} Σ|l_k(x)|: the minimum over subintervals of the maximum Lebesgue function value. This measures the best subinterval's worst-case amplification.

title: Erdős's √n Bound
content: Erdős initially proved Υ < √n, establishing polynomial growth but far from the conjectured logarithmic bound.

title: Sharp Logarithmic Bound
content: Υ ≤ (2/π) log n + O(1). This confirms Erdős's conjecture that Υ ≪ log n, with the sharp constant 2/π.

title: De Boor–Pinkus Characterization
content: The points maximizing Υ are exactly those for which the maximum Lebesgue function is equal on all subintervals — an equioscillation property.
